perturbation.original_text:
10.4 Payment of Invoices
Each invoice provided by Supplier to Customer under Section 10.1, to the extent accurate, shall be paid by Customer to Supplier within [* * *] after
the date of the invoice to the extent that Customer does not reasonably dispute that portion of the invoice in good faith.
All payments will be made in U.S. Dollars by SWIFT bank transfer directly to the Supplier account as specified in the respective Purchase Orders.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.4 Payment of Invoices
Each invoice provided by Supplier to Customer under Section 10.1, to the extent accurate, shall be paid by Customer to Supplier within [* * *] after
the date of the invoice to the extent that Customer does not reasonably dispute that portion of the invoice in good faith. However, payment terms may be extended to [* * *] with prior written approval from Supplier.
All payments will be made in U.S. Dollars by SWIFT bank transfer directly to the Supplier account as specified in the respective Purchase Orders.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline. Initially, invoices are to be paid within [* * *]. The modified section introduces an exception allowing payment within [* * *] with the Supplier's written approval. This creates ambiguity about which payment term takes precedence without clarifying the conditions for the extension, potentially leading to disputes over late payment penalties and obligations.
